page.title: 09Principal Features 3
page.content: The Brecon and Abergavenny Canal was built to take coal to Brecon and to transport agricultural produce back to the industrial areas.Today the canal is used for pleasure.Some people,such as the members of Govilon Boat Club keep their own boats on the canal. Others bring their boats on trailers. Small boats may be hired or people can choose to take a trip up the canal on one of the larger pleasure boats.The canal also provides a popular walking place.Abergavenny Castle is in ruins. A building in the style of a keep has been built in the castle grounds and Abergavenny Museum is housed in an adjacent building.
